results.title: Advanced passenger train
results.brief_description: Gives an insight into British Rail’s Experimental Advanced Passenger Train powered by gas turbines and with a host of revolutionary ideas such as a tilting system to stabilise the train at speed on sharp curves and hydro-kinetic braking.

results.title: Adults as learners. No. 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Anthony Cash, Roger Owen and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Teaching Adults”.
Demonstrates in a machine shop situation how blind workers are taught. A practising artist explains to a group of varying ages and educational background the fundamentals of abstract art.

results.title: Adults as learners. No. 1 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Anthony Cash, Roger Owen and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Teaching Adults”.
Examples of formal teaching and teaching by discovery with two groups of British Railways workers learning elementary electricity. A lesson on chess for a beginner, by the discovery method, is used to support the discussion.

results.title: Adult literacy
results.brief_description: Several people who learnt to read in adulthood, through the B.B.C. ‘On the way’ program, explain what difference doing so has made to them.

results.title: The Computer Centre
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adults Learning”.
A teaching aid to promote group discussion on the apprehension adults feel in adapting to computer technology. Shows a group of trainees being taught the operation of punch cards as part of a session in the use of computers.

results.title: The Adolescent
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Lauzun, ExPro George Movshon, United Nations Films and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: ‘De Dam’ in Amsterdam is the capital of adolescent Europe, a town square beside a canal where the young of four continents gather, talk, sing and love. In its search to find and know what the new generation thinks and feels about the world, the United Nations sent a camera crew to the Netherlands, spoke to many youths from England, Canada, Denmark, Switzerland and Malaysia, and caught a wide variety of attitudes on many public issues.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gilbert Lauzun, ExPro George Movshon, United Nations Films and United Nations Television

results.title: Adolescence
results.creator_credit: Daniel Riche, Philippe d'Argila and M K Productions
results.brief_description: A young girl takes ballet lessons with the Princess Troubetzkoy, a very old yet still famous ballerina. One day, she auditions for a ballet company, but another girl gets the job. So the girl goes back to the Princess to continue her studies. A sensitive study of an adolescent ballerina. With Sonia Petrovna and Madame Egorowa.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daniel Riche, Philippe d’Argila and M K Productions

results.title: Adolescence and learning disabilities (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Thomas G. Gregory and Lawren Productions
results.brief_description: Promotes general guidelines for understanding and helping the teenager with learning problems. Interviews professionals and specialists who deal with learning-disabled teenagers, and with the adolescents themselves.

results.title: ADMA for short
results.creator_credit: Ronnie Anscombe, James Carr, British Petroleum and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: The building of ADMA enterprise, a special oil drilling platform developed for underwater oil exploration. Exploring for oil on the bed of the Persian Gulf involved the development of this floating platform in a shipyard on Kiel Canal, and the transformation of Das Island, an uninhabited outcrop of rock in the Persian Gulf, into an outpost of industrial civilisation, complete with harbour, airstrip, living quarters and workshops.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronnie Anscombe, James Carr, British Petroleum and World Wide Pictures
